humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that two out of three sentinel lymph nodes are positive for metastatic carcinoma (AJCC pN1), and there is extranodal extension present. This information supports the prediction of N1 as the pathologic N stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has infiltrating ductal carcinoma in the right breast, with a 2.4 x 2.1 x 1.5 cm mass (AJCC pT2). Ductal carcinoma in situ, intermediate nuclear grade, is present, comprising approximately 5% of the tumor volume. Angiolymphatic invasion is present. Two out of three sentinel lymph nodes are positive for metastatic carcinoma (AJCC pN1), with extranodal extension. Thirteen additional axillary lymph nodes are negative for tumor. Therefore, the N stage is N1.
